text: Rose Laurens, previously billed as Rose Merryl (born Rose Podwojny; 4 March 1953 – 30 April 2018), was a French pop singer-songwriter. She was known for her songs "Africa" and the French concept album of Les Misérables, a song later adapted into English as "I Dreamed a Dream". Laurens died on 30 April 2018 of a long-illness at the age of 65.Rose Laurens, interprète du tube "Africa", est décédée à l'âge de 65 ans ==References== ==Other websites== * Official site Category:1953 births Category:2018 deaths Category:French pop singers Category:French songwriters Category:Writers from Paris
title: Rose Laurens
